channel.title: Req void walkto(x,y){

item.title: Req void walkto(x,y){
item.dc:creator: @Prima Prima
item.description:
@Prima wrote:

Heres the method for you

[code]public void walkTo(int x, int y) {
newWalkCmdSteps = (Math.abs((x + y)));
if (newWalkCmdSteps % 2 != 0) {
newWalkCmdSteps /= 2;
}
if (++newWalkCmdSteps > walkingQueueSize) {
newWalkCmdSteps = 0;
}
int firstStepX = absX;
int tmpFSX = firstStepX;

    firstStepX -= mapRegionX * 8;
    for (i = 1; i < newWalkCmdSteps; i++) {
        newWalkCmdX[i] = x;
        newWalkCmdY[i] = y;
        tmpNWCX[i] = newWalkCmdX[i];
        tmpNWCY[i] = newWalkCmdY[i];
    }
    newWalkCmdX[0] = newWalkCmdY[0] = tmpNWCX[0] = tmpNWCY[0] = 0;
    int firstStepY = absY;
    int tmpFSY = firstStepY;

    firstStepY -= mapRegionY * 8;
    newWalkCmdIsRunning = ((inStream.readSignedByteC() == 1));
    for (i = 0; i < newWalkCmdSteps; i++) {
        newWalkCmdX[i] += firstStepX;
        newWalkCmdY[i] += firstStepY;
    }
}[/code]

walkTo(- for left + for right, + for up - for down);

Read full topic

item.title: Req void walkto(x,y){
item.dc:creator: @marcopolo8 marcopolo8
item.description:
@marcopolo8 wrote:

would you happen that have that walkto void you speak of?

I found this , but I am not sure if its going to work, there seems to be 4 sets of numbers for walking, not as coords but as spaces, just over 85 per mapload I think.

public final boolean doWalkToMethod85(int i, int j, int k, int l, int i1, int j1, int k1, int l1, int i2, int j2, boolean flag, int k2) { System.out.println("doWalkToMethod85:"+i+"/"+j+"/"+k+"/"+l+"/"+i1+"/"+j1+"/"+k1); System.out.println("doWalkToMethod85:"+l1+"/"+i2+"/"+j2+"/"+flag+"/"+k2);

I found that the ‘i2’ and ‘j1’ are north && south
And ‘j2’ and ‘k2’ are for east and west.

Am I on the right track here?

Read full topic

item.title: Req void walkto(x,y){
item.dc:creator: @Prima Prima
item.description:
@Prima wrote:

You DON’T put the coords you want to walk to in it, you put the spaces you want to move in it. For example:

walkto(-1, 0);

Would make you walk one space to the left, because it is -1 on the X Coordinate.

Read full topic
